Cell.Data: Integrate npf_mgmt, and all the other scripts to a DLL invoked by the installer. This should hopefully prevent people from screwing up the installer.
Try to recompile nsis to have support for installation logging. Or find another solution for the logging.
Some users reported that the installer detects winpcap as already installer, while it's not there.
There's a memory leak while listing the adapters.
Convert all the IOCTL codes using the CTL_CODE macro instead of random numbers (as it is now).
Implement security of the adapters, using the code provided someone last year.
Clean up the documentation layout using the approach used in OEM WinPcap/
Use a single version file for all the binaries, as we do for OEM WinPcap.
Remove the code that downloads the first page from the WinPcap web site.
Clean up the read and write routines, trying to remove the PREfast errors. UPDATE: NPF_Write is ok, no more warnings from PREFast. NPF_BufferedWrite still in progress.
Implement some mechanism to notify the user of an unbinding operation, or cable unplugged.
Cleanup the dllMain function: at the moment we are calling functions that are not allowed to be called from within DllMain (like "system()").
Test the driver against the NDIStest and against the normal HCT tests.
Try to fix all the compilation warnings.

Write down a (better) document that details how to 1. integrate the libpcap sources 2. update the versions 3. compile every binary 4. generate the documentation 5. update the installer 6. compile the installer 7. package everything for the release 8. package everything for SCM
Support for loopback capture on the local machine

Add support for security permissions when accessing the winpcap driver. Add a control panel applet to control permissions. Add to the applet a default filter that the administrator can use to limit the traffic that normal users can see.
check dialup on Vista. NetMon is not available on Vista. Need to install NetMon as a separate package. In any case the winpcap DLL nstalled on Vista has NEtMon support disabled.
support for the "Any" device, in a way similar to linux
flow distribution engine, to split the traffic from an interface to several user-level threads according to customizable rules.
improvement of remote capture. Integration with libpcap.
merge the doxygen documentation with the libpcap sources. This would be a joint effort with the tcpdump.org team.
Add support for sniffing on the USB bus. This would have been terrific help while developing the wireless driver!

Create a dynamic report system to create a database of working and non-working cards. The non-working cards can be reported explicitly or automatically by winpcap. The users will be able to query the database from the WinPcap website.
Add statistic counters for packet transmission
IOCTL-like call to set-get low-level parameters of an adapters. E.g. MAC address, wireless settings, link speed…
Cleanup the installer. At the moment there is some spaghetti code in the script.
Some of the samples do not use the const keyword for the packet returned by pcap_next_ex and similar. As a consequence, the code compiles in a .c file, but not on a CPP file.

Right after the TRACE_MESSAGE call, the code calls NPF_StartUsingBinding. Any error path after this calls NPF_StopUsingBinding, except one -- if the buffer is too small, the code calls the SET_FAILURE_BUFFER_SMALL() macro, then breaks out of the case, but it doesn't NPF_StopUsingBinding that I can see. I'm not sure it matters, either, but it *might* end up deadlocking when npf gets unloaded. (This is packetNtx/driver/Packet.c, near line 1524.)
the "stats" example decodes the data from the driver in a quite dirty way. Make it more elegant.
IOCTL-like system to get and set adapter options, or use the OIDs from wpcap.dll

winpcap seems to crash when transmitting 0-length packets. NOTE GV (20060713): tried to replicate the problem on a XP VM, the driver fails the write request if the packet is 0 bytes. Asked Jsimmons to report a crash dump in order to analyze what's going on. UPDATE GV (20060725): the user is not able to replicate the problem again and report a crash dump. The bug is considered closed.

WinPcap interacts really badly with the SonicWall VPN client package. (http://help.mysonicwall.com/applications/vpnclient/). After installing WinPcap, the network stack seems to be dead. Uninstalling doesn't help. NOTE GV (20060714): tried the vpn software on a XP virtual machine, installing winpcap after VPN software. No problems have been encountered. I haven't tried to connect to a VPN to verify problems when a VPN is running.
The installer fails to install npf.sys on XPMCE installed on D:
Change the ifdefs for wanpacket on vista: we need to disable wanpacket, and don’t use the NT4 ifdef
The sample seems to crash when a dialup adapter is chosen.
The instructions say that the script to generate the devpack pauses at every step, it doesn't.
Fix the copyright printed upon execution (they say politecnico, netgroup and similar)

If a Nortel ExtraNOC VPN client is installed, WinPcap seems to fail listing the adapters properly. The reason for that is that the nortel client every now and then fails returning the adapter description, thus causing PGAN not to work properly.
In the vista installer, we do not check for previous versions of WinPcap (due to some problems calling Locate).

At the moment the dependency over wpcap.dll has been removed due to a compilation problem: we do not have a compilation configuration for the non-airpcap version of rpcapd, and so rpcapd forces the compilation of wpcap.dll w/ airpcap, which fails with the public sources if you don't have airpcap. The problem is that VC6 doesn't allow to declare dependencies over specific build configurations, only project names.
the adapter description is printed with a garbage char at the beginning. UPDATE: we do no longer support windows 9x.
under 9x/nt4, sometimes if crashes, sometimes if just reports garbage as error message.

The samples under PacketDriver in 9x show a list of adapters that contains more adapters than pcap_findalldevs. Trying to tx on some of them causes a blus screen. UPDATE: win 9x is no longer supported
PacketSetReadTmeout returns failure in case of airpcap adapters
The sample doesn't seem to work on airpcap adapters.

Under some circumstances, windump does not capture anything niether from the generic ndiswan nor from the specific one. If you use netcat, the packets are captured. The combination of OS/WinPcap version in which everything works or fails is still not clear. It seems to work on a clean XPSP2 VM over the CACE VPN, it fails on a clean XPSP2 machine.
The help message still gives Loris's old mail address at the Politecnico/Italy.
Cleanup the samples so that they have a consisten command line interface
Add some defines so that we can distinguish the new "style" of devpack (cleaned from the crap) and the old crappy spaghetti devpack
Fix the problem of the installer failing when dialup is not available.

The installer doesn’t detect the previous installation correctly and simply overwrites the files of the old version. Everything works fine after this but there are leftover links in the start menu (and contorl panel probably). The bug is present in 4.0.1 and 4.0.2 when upgrading from 4.0. The bug appears on Vista x64 only.
There are problems while uninstalling the driver (-1) during an upgrade but the new driver gets installed properly. The bug appears on NT4 only.
Add a checkbox to enable automatic start of the driver upon boot
